intro: Eleocharis dietrichiana, commonly known as the dwarf spikerush, is a species of flowering plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded soils, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems that are often covered in small, spiky structures called spikelets. Its flowers are usually tiny and clustered, and it produces small, three-angled fruits. Eleocharis dietrichiana plays an important role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
